reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Global trends in modes of childbirth - seminar series

description.narrative: The seminar series ?Global trends in modes of childbirth? will be organized in late 2015 by Physicians for Social Responsibility (PSR-Finland) in cooperation with the Finnish Society of Obstetrics and Gynaecology. The seminar series includes lecture events seminars and discussions on recent global trends in delivery modes background factors as well as their socioeconomic and health impacts in developing middle-income and developed countries. Marked variation exists in the rates of vaginal and operative deli veries worldwide due to different socioeconomic cultural and health care related factors. The global trends of childbirth are affected by discrepancies in distribution of wealth gender equity and human rights. Although maternal mortality rates are low in d eveloped countries and most babies are born in hospitals new challenges have emerged in middle and high-income countries by unnecessarily high cesarean section rates higher age of childbearing obesity and diabetes and fear of childbirth (horror partus). In addition recently there has been public discussion in Finland regarding home deliveries as well as centralization of deliveries in larger obstetric units. In contrast the least developed countries still face the problem of high maternal and perinatal morb idity and mortality with most births taking place at home without a skilled birth attendant. Seminars and discussions will be organized in four university cities in Finland and one city with secondary-level referral hospital and schools of nursing or midwi fery In addition several smaller hospitals in various parts of the country will be reached through distance video connections. The seminar series includes lecture and discussion events targeting healthcare professionals and students. The audience will be p rovided with information regarding latest research on the global trends of childbirth by invited international and Finnish expert lecturers. All events will include interactive panel discussions on the differences and mutual challenges of global trends in child birth and it?s influence on maternal and child health.
